arm_group.description: 10 allogeneic stem cell transplant/GVHD subjects with severe dry eye symptoms from ocular rosacea unresponsive to conventional management will be treated with monthly over 4 months with IPL and meibomian gland expression

brief_summary.textblock:
Is Intense Pulsed Light (IPL) treatment and eyelid meibomian gland manual expression safe
      and effective for allogeneic stem cell transplant patients with ocular rosacea in the
      setting of quiescent graft-versus-host disease?

clinical_study.brief_title: Intense Pulsed Light (IPL) and Meibomian Gland Expression to Treat Ocular Rosacea Secondary to Inactive Chronic Ocular GVHD

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Ocular rosacea with inactive GVHD

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Active GVHD

          -  Facial laser treatment

          -  Accutane exposure

          -  Inability to wear sun protection factor (SPF) 30 sunscreen and avoid sun exposure

          -  Inability to meet study requirements

clinical_study.official_title: Intense Pulsed Light (IPL) and Meibomian Gland Expression to Treat Ocular Rosacea Secondary to Inactive Chronic Ocular Graft Versus Host Disease (GVHD)

primary_outcome.description: Identify 10 allogeneic stem cell transplant/GVHD subjects with severe dry eye symptoms from ocular rosacea unresponsive to conventional management and treat with monthly IPL and meibomian gland expression over 4 months with an 8 month monitoring period
primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants who respond to IPL

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants who experience adverse events
